result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrius J Powell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darrius J Powell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Puck Tsai in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Darrius J Powell appeared by phone means. Court asks introductory quesitons.  Defendant waives appearance in court.  Request to appear by phone.  Attorney Tsai gives sentencing agreement.  State agrees.  No contest plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court imposes sentence.
Count 1:
$243.00 fine/costs and $200.00 DNA surcharge, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
Cash bond to apply.
Count 2: Dismissed
Paperwork handed in court.
Darrius Powell
Return date on April 13, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Puck Tsai in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tsai states matter is resolved but DE couldn't be here as he's homeless and moving between houses due to a house fire.  Having trouble getting DE here or by telephone.  New address provided.  State notes number of prior resets/requests warrant.  Parties argue.  Court states prospect of telephone plea was brooched in front of Judge Reynolds in January.  Suggests one more reset so matter is back in front of Judge Reynolds.  Parties argue further.  Court resets matter.  Return date scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Puck Tsai in court.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tsai states matter is resolved but DE needs time to get here as he doesn't have transportation from IL and has had a house fire.  State objects to 30 days as requested.  Court grants reset.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Return date at 07-29-2015 01:00 pm

Attorney Puck Tsai in court.  Sue Mueller and Rick S. appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Auth filed and approved.  Offer has been received.  Needs to still reach defendant to discuss that offer.  Defendant resides in IL.  Request more time to make that contact.  State agrees to 3 week reset.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
15R 011806 - No contact w/Wilderness Resort; Absolute Sobriety

Pre-trial conference at 06-19-2015 10:30 am.
Return date at 07-02-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Darrius J Powell appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Puck Tsai. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller and intern Rick Spoentgen appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. Advised rights to an attorney. State requests $500 Cash w/conditions.  Atty. Tsai states DE does qualify and requests $150 cash or PA bond.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $500.00 Cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/Wilderness Resort; Absolute Sobriety; No possession of controlled substances  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Return date scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
